articles.title: Kim Yong Nam greets President of Benin
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam greets President of Benin 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) - Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Mathieu Kerekou, President of Benin, on July 29 on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the President, government and people of Benin greater success in their work for national unity and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: SPA chairman meets Thai parliamentary delegation
articles.content:
SPA chairman meets Thai parliamentary delegation 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) - Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, had a talk with the delegation of the Senate of Thailand headed by its first vice-president Pichet Pattanachote, when the latter paid a courtesy call on the former, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
 The head of the delegation said that while staying in the DPRK he could witness at first hand the might of the single-hearted unity of the Korean people and the progress of the DPRK.   
 He praised the mass gymnastic and artistic performance Arirang as the world's best masterpiece.

articles.title: DPRK foreign minister meets U.S. state secretary
articles.content:
DPRK foreign minister meets U.S. state secretary 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) - DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun attending the ministerial meeting of the 9th ASEAN Regional Forum on July 31 met U.S. State Secretary Powell in Bandar Seri Begawan, the capital city of Brunei Darussalam and discussed the issue of resuming the U.S.-DPRK dialogue at the proposal of the U.S. side.
 Powell expressed the U.S. stand to resume the U.S.-DPRK dialogue aimed to discuss issues of bilateral concern without preconditions and reiterated its intention to send U.S. assistant secretary of state Kelly to Pyongyang soon.   
 Paek Nam Sun recalled that the DPRK had already consented to the U.S. side's proposal to dispatch Pritchard, special envoy of the U.S. State Department for negotiations with the DPRK, to Pyongyang to explain the stand of resuming the dialogue and accepted its later proposal to send U.S. assistant secretary of state Kelly to Pyongyang as a special envoy of the U.S. President. He welcomed the proposal of the U.S. state secretary to dispatch the special envoy of the U.S. President to the DPRK.

articles.title: Reception given by Cuban charge d'affaires
articles.content:
Reception given by Cuban charge d'affaires 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) - Cuban charge d'affaires Violeta Goodridge Culzac here gave a reception at the embassy Wednesday evening on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of the attack on Moncada barracks.
 Present on invitation were minister of education Pyon Yong Rip, who is the chairman of the Korea-Cuba Solidarity Committee, minister of foreign trade Ri Kwang Gun, acting chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Mun Jae Chol and other officials concerned.   
 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.content:
Signature campaign conducted in Ukraine 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) - Over 349,000 Ukrainians participated in the international signature campaign supporting the June 15 north-south joint declaration and demanding the immediate withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea.
 Pyotr Simonenko, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Ukrainian Communist Party, signed the signature paper on behalf of 46 members of the Ukrainian Supreme Council (parliament) and 142,000 party members, Alexander Bondarchyuk, chairman of the All-Ukraine Workers' Union, on behalf of 20,000 unionists, Anatoli Domanski, chairman of the All-Ukraine Sovietic Officers' Union, on behalf of 130,000 unionists, Yekaterina Samoilik, chairwoman of the Ukrainian Feminine Workers' Union, on behalf of 50,000 unionists and Andrei Pliit, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Lenin Communist Youth Union of Ukraine, on behalf of 7,000 unionists.

Book "charm of century" off the press
articles.content:
Book "charm of century" off the press 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) - The Literature and Art Publishing House has recently brought out a book "Charm of century" (visitor's book of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace and collection of true stories Vol. 1).
 It consists of five chapters. Edited in the book are nearly 30 true stories as well as entries in the visitor's book of the memorial palace.   
 The true stories and entries are about the visitors' boundless reverence for President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Proper stand on inter-Korean relations called for
Transfer of criminal jurisdiction to S. Korea called for
articles.content:
Transfer of criminal jurisdiction to S. Korea called for 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) - Father Mun Jong Hyon and representatives of civic and public organizations of south Korea went on sit-in strike in Seoul on July 27, enraged at the authorities who do not exercise the jurisdiction over the GI criminals who ran an armored car over schoolgirls to death, according to a news report.
 They expressed indignation at the authorities who do not take any measures though more than 200,000 persons participated in the signature campaign denouncing the GIs' killing.   
 They continued the sit-in strike, chanting such slogans as "Transfer criminal jurisdiction to south Korea", "Bush, make an open apology" and "form a joint fact-finding group".

articles.title: Surprise demonstration staged against 8th U.S. army command
articles.content:
Surprise demonstration staged against 8th U.S. army command 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) - 19 students under the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils staged a surprise demonstration against the base of the 8th U.S. army command in Ryongsan on July 30 in protest against its refusal to transfer the jurisdiction to south Korea, according to a news report.
 They marched as far as 300 meters inside the base and staged a fierce anti-U.S. struggle, chanting such slogans as "President Bush, make an apology" and "bring our younger sisters to life", scattering hundreds of copies of literature and burning the stars and stripes.   
 In the literature titled "We warn U.S. Forces present in south Korea and U.S. President Bush" they wrote that they would launch a more powerful second and third struggles till the day they have brought to the court of south Korea the GI criminals who killed schoolgirls, punished them and wrested an open apology from Bush.

articles.title: S. Korea urged to stop depending on outsiders
articles.content:
S. Korea urged to stop depending on outsiders 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) - The Romanian Geniul Carpatilor Association for International Friendship, Solidarity, Reconciliation and Cooperation sent a letter to the south Korean embassy in Bucharest on July 24. It said that the June 15 north-south joint declaration should be implemented to the letter as it is a historic decision made by the authorities of the north and the south to promote the process of independent and peaceful reunification on the Korean peninsula.
 Foreign interference is only laying obstacles to the vital interests of the Korean nation, the letter said, demanding the south Korean authorities take steps to implement the historic June 15 joint declaration and thus defuse the tension on the Korean peninsula and reject the interference of the outside forces trying to obstruct national reunification and ignite a destructive war.
